level.heading: STANDARD CONTRACT CLAUSES AND CONTRACT COMPLIANCE (ยง 19-2818)

level.text: All Board contracts for supplies, services, and construction shall include standard contract clauses and contract compliance provisions which define the responsibilities and rights of the parties to the contract.
The CCO may exercise the option to renew a contract a maximum of two (2) times, provided the total contract period does not exceed four (4) years, pursuant to the following circumstances:
The contract renewal provision was included in the original solicitation with optional year cost proposal;
Contractor has demonstrated satisfactory performance; and
A price analysis, if considered appropriate by the CCO, indicates that the cost remains competitive.
The following shall be standard contract provisions for Board procurements to be included in all formal solicitations:
Changes and stop work order clauses;
Termination clauses for default and convenience;
Inspection clauses for supplies and services; and
The following shall be standard contract compliance provisions to be required in all Board solicitations:
Laws and regulations incorporated by reference provision;
Ethical standards for Board employees and former Board employees provision;
Gratuities and officers not to benefit provisions;
Walsh Healey Public Contracts Act provision;
Utilization of minority business enterprises provision;
Utilization of District-based enterprises provision; and
The Board may, in its sole discretion, include any other contract clause or provision in any IFB or RFP issued by the Board.

Any contract clause or provision that is included in the IFB or RFP shall be incorporated into and made a part of the contract that arises out of the IFB or RFP, unless the contract contains an express provision excluding the incorporation of any particular clause or clauses from the contract.
